article.headline: UT-Chattanooga 75, Western Carolina 66
article.story: CULLOWHEE, N.C. (AP) -- Chris Brown scored 18 points and grabbed 10 rebounds to help Chattanooga beat Western Carolina 75-66 on Thursday night. Charles Anderson chipped in 11 while Mindaugas Katelynas had 9 points and 14 rebounds for the Mocs (16-8, 9-5 Southern Conference). David Berghoefer led the Catamounts (8-19, 3-11) with 21 points and seven rebounds, despite making just 3-of-10 attempts from the free-throw line. The team was 5 of 18 from the line for the game. Negus McKenna scored a career-high 14 points. Trey Hopkins also scored 14 and made 4 of 10 3-point attempts. Chattanooga made 20 of 29 free-throw attempts and outrebounded Western Carolina 51-32, including 11 offensive rebounds. The Catamounts made a 14-3 run to tie the game at 45 with 11:44 remaining. Chattanooga responded by building an 11-point lead over the next few minutes. Western Carolina got no closer than five the rest of the way and Casey Long sealed the win by making eight free-throws in the final 1:05.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
